授業目的: The lecture intends to outline different developments of the automobile industry in different world regions and to compare the development strategies of major manufacturing locations in various world regions. By doing so, students ought to learn that despite the common perception of a global automobile industry, the reality is that the automobile industry is very much regionally fragmented and has to adjust to various different regional socio-economic and political environments.
到達目標: Students are supposed to acquire profound knowledge of the discussion about regionalization and globalization of the auto industry as well as a broad understanding of specific regional economic structures, market peculiarities and different national automobile policies. Evaluation of students' performance will be based on: 60% participation and contribution to the course and 40% final presentation
関連科目: All management and economy related courses of the EUIJ certificate program (enrollment in the program required in order to attend courses at Kobe and Osaka Universities)
授業方法:
Face-to-face lecture.
PPP presentation and class discussion; the course follows more a seminar approach with much discussion, rather than a lecture style format
